reviews.review_msg: Most haughty, officious professor that ever existed

This was a fantastic course.  It wasn't easy, but it was really valuable and worth all the work.  The intructor  wove theory and practice together in meaningful, relevant and interesting ways; every class was engaging. The best course I took this semester - a must for all teachers.

This was a fantastic course.  If Kelli is teaching this summer this is the course to take.  She is a gifted teacher - knowledgeable, caring, and interesting.  This was the most relevant and useful Educ class I took - a must for teachers.
It's too bad she isn't teaching summer 08.  I have heard that this is the bes Educ course to take.  I have been waiting to register for her class.
This was a wonderful course, relevant, meaningful, and worth all the work.

She is a very passionate teacher who loves teaching and books. Her passion comes out in class and at times is a bit overwelming. While this class has a heavy primary focus it was still an enjoyable and interesting class. I learned a great deal about how to set up a literacy program, assess my students reading and writing and loved readers theatre!

Want to really learn all about teaching Language Arts - wow, take this course.  This professor is great!  she's entertaining and cares about her students.  She is one of the most genuine and knowledgeable profs up at SFU.
Excellent course.  The best educ course I took.  Kelli was amazing, talk about relevant, purposeful, interesting and fun.  A must to take.
This was an amazing course - interesting, useful, fun, relevant, purposeful.  It was the most worthwhile course I took in the faculty of education.

I loved this class!The information provided by Kelli was thought provoking and can be easily applied in a class.Her course has influenced my approach to literacy immensely.She is a wonderful (not to mention hot) professor whos love and passion for education and literacy is easily seen in this course

This is the best course I have ever taken at SFU.  Professor is amazing - smart, thoughtful, enthusiastic, caring, and totally worthwhile.  The readings, tasks, assignments are great.  I highly recommend Professor Vogstad.
No Comments

Lots of required reading.  Doesn't practice what she preaches about good teaching.  Marks fair but will drop you down from a high mark at course end if she doesn't like you with no discussion allowed.

I LOVED SUSAN AS A PROF!!! She is one of my favourite education profs and is very knowledgable and reflective in her practice. I found her assignments to be engaging, useful, and relevant to the environments that we will engage in as future teachers. She was happy to discuss assignments and answer questions that I had throughout the semester!

If you are reading this then avoid her and her courses at all costs. I cannot stress enough how poor the curriculum and design course is. She is rude, unclear with assignments, and overall a bore. I did decent in the class but would have much preferred to have a more educational course for the amount of work she expects. Trust me. AVOID.

Lots of class and small group discussions. Readings are not difficult, though time-consuming,  Assignment criteria and expectations are often confusing, but just ask for clarity - everyone else has the same questions! Easy marker, just make an effort to do the work.

Susan is very knowledgeable about the topic. She taught this course at both Surrey and Burnaby campus. Although she assigned the readings, she usually talks about them in class as well. 20% participation, 30% research paper, 20% discussion online, 30% group presentation.

This class cost me distinction on my second degree. The final project was a lot of work and not well organized. The participation grades were a mystery until we got our final grades back, which were very late. Colleen takes questions about her class as criticism. I strongly advise taking EDUC 472 with someone else if you care about your grades.

The way Colleen structures and grades EDUC 472 is anti-student success. She gave us a ton of little assignments for our participation grade that she often just dropped on us with a few days notice. Despite doing all of them, I did not get full marks for participation. Our last assignment took a very long time to do as the instructions were unclear.

Colleen graded our class very late. When I got my grade back, even though I did all the items for participation, I did not get full grades for them. I did not receive any comments on them and she has been dismissive about my concerns via email. Stuff is difficult to keep track of in this course due to no outline, take 472 with anybody else.

There was lots of busy work in terms of participation assignments. I did all of them and participated in every class, but did not get full participation marks. When I asked Colleen, she said that she felt I could have improved on some of the assignments, but she gave no feedback at all in the course. She cost me a letter grade; I deserve that A.

I liked having Colleen as a prof. One thing worth mentioning is that there were a lot of small/random ungraded assignments that counted toward participation, which were slightly difficult to keep track of. The literacy toolkit (final assignment) was also quite time consuming, but will be very helpful for 405 in the long run.

Easily the worst course of my academic term in my B.Ed. Degree. Colleen has this very strange behaviour where, when she doesn't like what you are saying/doing, she frowns at you. Imagine putting a ton of effort into a topic, then doing your best to participate while your professor sits there frowning every time you talk. I really hated this class.

This is the second course I have taken with Colleen, and it is just as bad as EDUC 400. Colleen doesn't understand that by not documenting a proper course outline for us, we can potentially have troubles getting certified we our courses are reviewed. She says she uses a "living document" teaching style to test our adaptability, but it's just lazy.

As of writing this, several assignments have had their requirements changed which is very frustrating. Half of my class dropped out to go to the other teacher teaching this course this term as Colleen cannot seem to keep her class on track. She makes constant excuses and takes any questions about the course as criticism. She is not a good teacher.
